title: Automation and Controls Senior Analyst
job_description: We are: Looking to be part of a transformational digital engineering and manufacturing practice? How about an opportunity to help world-class clients solve their biggest challenges and create products and services that customers love - quickly, efficiently and sustainably?Industry X combines Accenture’s powerful digital capabilities with deep engineering and manufacturing expertise. We use the power of data and digital to help our clients reimagine the products they make, and how they make them. By connecting engineering and manufacturing operations every step of the way - from how products are designed and engineered, sourced and supplied, manufactured, to how they are serviced and renewed, we help them achieve greater productivity, drive growth and meet their sustainability commitments. Find out more about Industry X.The Work: As an Automation Controls Senior Analyst you will: Be responsible for the completion of all project requirements, including, but not limited to: Participate or lead internal and or customer consultations regarding field of expertise Identify, assess, and solve complex technical problems for area of responsibility, using in-depth analysis of situations or data and incorporating innovative approaches and techniques. Develop proposals for business development opportunities and present to senior leadership at potential clients.  Ability to turn broad program objectives into actionable design initiatives Plan and execute system specification, design, architecture, and development Develop standards, procedures, training manuals, and other documentation for projects or internal use Delivery of virtual Commissioning /Emulation, Testing and Simulation  Maintain and improve client relationships with all engineering disciplines and identify and develop new business opportunities  Mange the project resources and budgets when necessary Job Requirements:Must have willingness and ability to travel domestically approximately 25-50% as needed based on client delivery needsHere’s what you need:  Bachelor's degree or equivalent (minimum 12 years) work experience. (If Associates Degree, must have minimum 6 years’ work experience)1 + years experience in controls engineering within a manufacturing environment.Bonus Points if:Possess a basic understanding of plant processes in both Process and Discrete Manufacturing Industries to assist with the conceptual design of process control strategies for process modifications and plant expansions.1+ years experience in automation system design, software integration, development, commissioning, validation, and start-upExperience with PLC/HMI/SCADA/DCS systems (Rockwell, Schneider, Siemens, AVEVA, Ignition) and control system architectureValid passport and ability to travel within Canada, the US and internationally Compensation at Accenture varies depending on a wide array of factors, which may include but are not limited to the specific office location, role, skill set, and level of experience. As required by local law, Accenture provides a reasonable range of compensation for roles that may be hired in California, Colorado, New York or Washington as set forth below.We accept applications on an on-going basis and there is no fixed deadline to apply.Information on benefits is here.Role Location Hourly RangeCalifornia $26.20 to $69.76Colorado $26.20 to $60.29New York $24.28 to $69.76Washington $27.93 to $64.18What We BelieveWe have an unwavering commitment to diversity with the aim that every one of our people has a full sense of belonging within our organization. title: Commercial Lender
job_description: Rain Maker Needed!Our client, is an innovative financial institution with an exceptional culture, is seeking a talented Commercial Lender to join their team. This is an amazing opportunity for candidates who are looking to take their career in commercial lending to the next level. Are you a "Rainmaker" lending officer, if so then call me. Do you consider yourself a "Heavy Hitter "in your territory, you should be working for my client because they treat "Rainmakers" and "Heavy Hitters" like the valuable contributors that they are. My client has a well thought out career path that allows for significant career advancement if you are one of these exceptional people.  In addition, they have a compensation plan that geared for "Rainmakers" and "Heavy Hitters."Position: Commercial LenderResponsibilities Provide excellent customer service by building and maintaining strong relationships with clients Assess creditworthiness and evaluate financial statements to determine loan eligibility Develop and implement loan structures that meet both the needs of the client and the institution Collaborate with internal teams to ensure efficient loan processing and timely loan closings Maintain knowledge of industry trends, regulations, and compliance guidelinesEssential Job Functions Originate, underwrite, and close commercial loans Actively prospect and market to potential new clients Analyze credit risk and make informed lending decisions Monitor and manage existing loan portfolios Stay up-to-date on market conditions and identify new business opportunitiesCandidates please pay careful attention: Only those candidates who meet the minimum and mandatory requirements below will be considered.Skills 5+ years of experience in commercial lending Strong knowledge of financial analysis and underwriting principles Prior experience as a loan underwriter or credit analyst is MANDATORY.Prior experience in preparation of loan memorandums for credit committee approval is also MANDATORY. Formal Credit Training in your background is Desirable. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills Proven track record of achieving loan production goals Familiarity with lending regulations and compliance standardsBenefits Competitive salary: $100,000 to $169,000 Standard medical and dental coverage Additional benefits package availableIf you are a seasoned Commercial Lender looking to join a dynamic and forward-thinking financial institution, we want to hear from you! You can reach me directly at jj.flores@gogpac.comAll qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, age, color, sex (including pregnancy), religion, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, military status, genetic information, or any other status protected by applicable laws or regulations.GPAC (Growing People and Companies) is an award-winning search firm specializing in placing quality professionals within multiple industries across the United States since 1990. We are extremely competitive, client-focused and realize that our value is in our ability to deliver the right solutions at the right time.

Daily responsibilities will be roughly 30% contract management, 30% negotiations and analysis of bids and sales, 30% compliance, and 10% process improvement.Responsible for leading the contract analysis, negotiation, execution and life-cycle management of complex civil and military contracts for manufacturing business within the aerospace supply chain.Consistently applies commercial knowledge and acumen for process improvement/implementation and improving the commercial capabilities of a business.Applies working knowledge of Trade/export compliance regulations and experience of US Government contracting regulations (FAR and DFAR)Manage the full life cycle of commercial contracts with customers and work to ensure that strong long-term contract financial performance is achieved in line with expectations.Skills & QualificationsThis role requires candidates to be ITAR eligible, with required compliance documents.Bachelors Degree or equivalent knowledge and experience required.Working Knowledge of Trade/Export compliance regulations required.Experience with US Government contracting regulations (FAR and DFAR).Additional/Further Education – Law certificates (LLB) preferred.Excellent communication skills – verbal and written – both internally and externally.About Aston CarterAston Carter provides world-class corporate talent solutions to thousands of clients across the globe. title: Technical Business Analyst
job_description: Technical Business AnalystOur client, a leading Pacific Northwest utility provider committed to public service and environmental preservation, is looking for a Technical Business Analyst for their Portland, Oregon location. In this role you will provide Business Analysis support for small to medium size projects and system administrator support within the IT PMO portfolio. Assignments are determined based on proposal or project needs and workload shifts. This position will work closely with a variety of internal clients, stakeholders, vendors, technical SMEs, and others with varying degrees of technical understanding to keep IT PMO systems and tools up to date. The manager or senior or lead analysts will provide support and direction to this contract position, which will be assigned to small to medium sized projects with an intermediate level of complexity.This hybrid position is a one-year renewable contract! If you think you’d be a good fit, we want to hear from you!Key Responsibilities for Technical Business Analyst:Provide business analysis support and assistance, eliciting documents and managing requirements, to support the implementation of IT systems for a variety of internal clients implementing small to medium -sized projects, as per org’s established System Life Cycle (SLC) process.Coordinate and facilitate planning and working sessions to elicit requirements. Guide and assist client teams through defining business requirements.Conduct user/stakeholder interviews, potentially including job shadowing and “day in the life” exercises.Review documentation on existing business processes and systems.Review regulations and policies to understand relevant compliance requirements and make recommendations.Provide user administration support; monitor and respond to all user/system requests; escalate to the System Owner / Information Owner (SO/IO) or vendor as needed.Maintain the backlog of defects and enhancement requests.Coordinate reporting and changes with the ISO/IO change control board.Analyze data gaps and assist with development of processes to address those gaps.Provide application system security support by adding, removing, or deleting users from systems, based on established access control policies.Complete and present monthly reports on system status.Regularly analyze system contents to maintain accuracy; work with appropriate project/portfolio managers to validate current data and perform system clean-up activities.Work with vendor to identify and implement O&M and enhancement work, including requirements gathering and user acceptance testing, and change management.Provide training and guidance on systems for users internal and external to IT.Support, coordinate, and help facilitate PMO governance processes, meetings, and workshops. Participate in and provide input to governance board process improvement activities.Organize and help develop methods to track upcoming deadlines, priority actions, and overdue deliverables.Track work deliverables/milestones, provide status updates to appropriate staff, and identify any expected delays or risks.Review operating practices and procedures to recommend whether improvements can be made in areas such as workflow, reporting procedures, and/or expenditures.Requirements for Technical Business Analyst:U.S. citizenship and valid driver’s license.A bachelor’s degree in information technology/systems, business administration, or a closely-related technical discipline is preferred.5 years of experience is required with an applicable bachelor’s degree.9 years of experience is required without a degree or applicable degree.Experience should be consistent with the specific requirements of system support and coordination and progressively more technical in nature. Requires a working knowledge of automated data systems. Proficiency with the RoboHelp tool.Proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite of products, including Word, PowerPoint, Excel, and Outlook.Technical interviewing skills that include:Functional/process interviewing in the business environment.The ability to facilitate groups through process design and requirements gathering sessions.Ability to communicate effectively with business and technical teams.Ability to develop and maintain effective client and stakeholder relationships.Strong technical writing skills and the ability to present information in various forms (verbally, in writing, visually/graphically).**We are unable to accommodate corp. to corp. candidates**About Motus Recruiting and Staffing, Inc:Founded in 2006, Motus is an award-winning recruiting and staffing firm in the Pacific Northwest, specializing in professional services and technology solutions. We are a group of people who not only recognize the importance of representation, but actively fight for diversity, equity, and inclusion in the recruitment process. Our goal is to educate organizations on the importance of DEI when hiring, promoting, and supporting diverse employees. We are calling organizations to demonstrate their commitment to DEI by being intentional about who they hire.All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, citizenship, disability or protected veteran status.LF/BH12358
Job function: Information Technology, Analyst, and General Business
Industries: Data Infrastructure and Analytics, Utilities Administration, and IT System Data Services

title: Technical Business Analyst 2
job_description: Title: Technical Business Analyst 2 Location: Portland, OR (hybrid)  Duration: 12-month Contract (with possible extensions up to 5 years) Pay Range: $52.90 $56.13 per hourThis contract Technical Business Analyst 2 position supports the Project Management team within the IT division of our Postland-based client. The role of the Technical Business Analyst is to perform interviews and research to determine IT business requirements and translate them into specifications for complex technical projects.Position Responsibilities Develop business process models and documentation. Develop, define, and build technology bias business cases that will enable business and technology change. Implement workflow across the organization. Recommend technology solutions to improve business decision-making with a focus on the core systems, technology strategies and standards. Conduct analysis of business issues and challenges. Participate in business process and technology initiatives to improve business performance. Act as liaison and participate in defining technology solutions to solve complex, multidisciplinary business problems with long-term implications. Document functional specifications, conversions, upgrades, interfaces, reports, forms, and workflow. Facilitate group meetings. Work with end-users to define and executing test scenarios and ensure appropriate end user training. Establish and maintain effective working relationships with clients across all levels of the organization. Develop and review audit and control processes to facilitate optimal service performance & operational integrity. Deal with workload peaks without compromising standards. Develop and support a knowledge management culture within the organization. Provide a sustainable IT infrastructure by supplying cross training and functional documentation. Balance technology and business issues as well as communicating with both technology and business experts. Provide support to the Infrastructure Systems Analyst to assist in identifying gaps in infrastructure services Understand the relationship between an application and the technical services it relies on. Define an application's portfolio of dependent services and technical needs. Identify the difference between an application and dependent software. Work with stakeholders to gather requirements geared towards upgrading to current technology and migrating to new infrastructure. Audit existing source(s) of record for application information to determine validity of data and make recommendations to correct. Negotiate priorities and resolve requirement conflicts among various stakeholders. Develop data flow models to define interdependencies between other applications.Position Requirements  Education & Corresponding Experience    A bachelor's degree in information technology/systems, business administration, or a closely-related technical discipline is preferred. 5 years of experience is required with an applicable bachelor's degree. 9 years of experience is required without a degree or applicable degree. Experience should be consistent with the specific requirements of system support and coordination and progressively more technical in nature. Requires a working knowledge of automated data systems.   Required Technical Skills & Experience    Proficiency with the RoboHelp tool. Proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite of products, including Word, PowerPoint, Excel, and Outlook. Technical interviewing skills that include: Functional/process interviewing in the business environment. The ability to facilitate groups through process design and requirements gathering sessions. Ability to communicate effectively with business and technical teams. Ability to develop and maintain effective client and stakeholder relationships. Strong technical writing skills and the ability to present information in various forms (verbally, in writing, visually/graphically).   Preferred Skills & Experience   Proficiency with requirements modeling tools such as Jama. Experience with System Life Cycle (SLC) processes. Experience with Visio flowcharts. Experience with Microsoft Project. Experience with Excel PowerQuery.Everest Consultants offers the following benefits for this position: medical, dental, & vision insurance, short-term disability, life and AD&D insurance, a 401(k) retirement plan, and a referral bonus program, paid sick/vacation/holidays, and a health and welfare fringe benefit.Everest Consultants is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, or any other characteristic protected by applicable local, state, or federal civil rights laws. #IND

title: Principal Business System Analyst-(SAP-FI)
job_description: A Day in Your Life at MKS:We are looking for an exceptional Principal Business Systems Analyst- SAP-FI, who can perform development, implementation and usage of Information Technology and management information systems within SAP ERP applications. Working in partnership with the business relationship managers, super-users, end-users and technical team, ensure full adoption, effective usage, and efficient deployment of our IT solutions. Effectively manage the change control process, gathering the end-user requirements, and communicating IT priorities and delivery status to the business.You Will Make an Impact By:Provide our Finance functional leadership leveraging business process, SAP configuration and optimal usage expertise. Collaborate with our Accounting department (AR/AP), Credit department, Tax controller, Treasury management teams and IT in the global design, development, and deployment and expansion of the SAP landscapes. Support the Finance organization primarily Americas, Finance operations group end-user community by providing research, analysis and problem resolution to team members. Actively demonstrate a passion for continuous improvement focused on end user productivity, and enterprise process integration. Work with various business groups in the organization to facilitate cross-functional implementation of new or improved business process requirements for all IT-related business, financial, and operations systems critical to core organizational functions. Effectively manage the IT change control process, gathering the end-user requirements, preparing functional specifications and communicating IT priorities and delivery status to the business. Skills You Will Bring: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Information Systems or a related technical field, or a Bachelor’s degree in Accounting or Finance, with a focus on information technology and SAP, including 5+ years of experience working in SAP applications, focusing on the Finance areas listed below. Minimum of 5 years of experience working in SAP applications, focusing on the Finance area: AR/AP, financial statements, banking interface, tax controlling and treasury management. Minimum of 7 years in SAP configurations and information technology experienceKnowledgeable in Order to Cash processes and understanding of integration with at least one of the third-party tools: Coupa, OneSource, Workday, Tax system, etc.) (at Least of One of them) Familiar with ABAPExperienced in MS Suite: PowerPoint, Excel- pivot tables, Word, etc. Must be fluent in English. Strong communication skills This position will be Hybrid at one of our MKS offices in the United States. Preferred Skills:Experience with tax determination tool as OneCloud (Thomson Reuters) is a plus. Strong team player with a can-do attitudeBe dissatisfied with status quo, with a thirst to introduce change. Compensation and Benefits:Salary Pay Range: $97,300 to $180,700 per year. This range is a good faith estimate of the expected salary range for this position, based on a wide range of factors including qualifications, experience and training, operational and business needs and other considerations permitted by law.  At MKS, it is not typical for an individual to be hired at or near the top of the range for the role.Bonus: This position is eligible for a discretionary annual bonus, in an amount to be determined by MKS [or as applicable].Benefits: MKS offers a comprehensive benefits package, including health insurance coverage (medical, dental and vision), 401(k) with company match, life and disability insurance, 12 paid holidays, sick time, 15 paid vacation days, [6 weeks fully paid] parental leave, adoption assistance and tuition reimbursement [and for participation in any stock programs, signing bonus, etc.].We are interested in qualified candidates who are eligible to work in the United States. However, we will not be sponsoring work visas for this position, at this time.

title: Senior BI Analyst, Credit Risk
job_description: DescriptionThe Senior BI Analyst, Credit Risk works independently to perform research, data extraction and analysis, building data and analytical tools and providing financial modeling to support the mitigation of credit risk. Focus areas include: calculation of the allowance and provision for loan loss, evaluating concentration risk, the study of macroeconomic effects on credit risk, portfolio characteristics and migration analysis.Here's what you can expect from the job and what you need to be successful:Job DutiesLead and develop complex financial modeling, particularly predictive loss models, cash flow modeling and title: Principal Business System Analyst-(SAP-FI)
job_description: A Day in Your Life at MKS:We are looking for an exceptional Principal Business Systems Analyst- SAP-FI, who can perform development, implementation and usage of Information Technology and management information systems within SAP ERP applications. Working in partnership with the business relationship managers, super-users, end-users and technical team, ensure full adoption, effective usage, and efficient deployment of our IT solutions. Effectively manage the change control process, gathering the end-user requirements, and communicating IT priorities and delivery status to the business.You Will Make an Impact By:Provide our Finance functional leadership leveraging business process, SAP configuration and optimal usage expertise. Collaborate with our Accounting department (AR/AP), Credit department, Tax controller, Treasury management teams and IT in the global design, development, and deployment and expansion of the SAP landscapes. Support the Finance organization primarily Americas, Finance operations group end-user community by providing research, analysis and problem resolution to team members. Actively demonstrate a passion for continuous improvement focused on end user productivity, and enterprise process integration. Work with various business groups in the organization to facilitate cross-functional implementation of new or improved business process requirements for all IT-related business, financial, and operations systems critical to core organizational functions. Effectively manage the IT change control process, gathering the end-user requirements, preparing functional specifications and communicating IT priorities and delivery status to the business. Skills You Will Bring: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Information Systems or a related technical field, or a Bachelor’s degree in Accounting or Finance, with a focus on information technology and SAP, including 5+ years of experience working in SAP applications, focusing on the Finance areas listed below. Minimum of 5 years of experience working in SAP applications, focusing on the Finance area: AR/AP, financial statements, banking interface, tax controlling and treasury management. Minimum of 7 years in SAP configurations and information technology experienceKnowledgeable in Order to Cash processes and understanding of integration with at least one of the third-party tools: Coupa, OneSource, Workday, Tax system, etc.) (at Least of One of them) Familiar with ABAPExperienced in MS Suite: PowerPoint, Excel- pivot tables, Word, etc. Must be fluent in English. Strong communication skills This position will be Hybrid at one of our MKS offices in the United States. Preferred Skills:Experience with tax determination tool as OneCloud (Thomson Reuters) is a plus. Strong team player with a can-do attitudeBe dissatisfied with status quo, with a thirst to introduce change. Compensation and Benefits:Salary Pay Range: $97,300 to $180,700 per year. This range is a good faith estimate of the expected salary range for this position, based on a wide range of factors including qualifications, experience and training, operational and business needs and other considerations permitted by law.  At MKS, it is not typical for an individual to be hired at or near the top of the range for the role.Bonus: This position is eligible for a discretionary annual bonus, in an amount to be determined by MKS [or as applicable].Benefits: MKS offers a comprehensive benefits package, including health insurance coverage (medical, dental and vision), 401(k) with company match, life and disability insurance, 12 paid holidays, sick time, 15 paid vacation days, [6 weeks fully paid] parental leave, adoption assistance and tuition reimbursement [and for participation in any stock programs, signing bonus, etc.].We are interested in qualified candidates who are eligible to work in the United States. However, we will not be sponsoring work visas for this position, at this time.

title: Business Data Analyst
job_description: ExamWorks is seeking a Business Data Analyst to join the team! If you are skilled in SQL queries, you may be the perfect fit.The Business Data Analyst is responsible to provide data quality assessment, data analysis, pattern and trend identification and data visualization. This position utilizes company systems and databases to extract and analyze data to interpret trends and work with management to make effective business decisions. This position demonstrates a team oriented approach, and strives to achieve superior customer service.Responsibilities Interpret data and analyze results using statistical techniques.  Work with upper management to prioritize business and information needs and identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets based on those needs.  Locate and define new process improvement opportunities, and productivity measures for the individual Business Units.  Manage and query relational databases and monitor for trends, errors and inconsistencies.  Create data visualizations to enable management team to make informed business decisions.  Analyze data and identify opportunities to support successful reporting enhancements.  Create and present ad hoc data analysis, reports and dashboards to inform members of management on sales metrics.  Develop predictive models that help make triaging, pricing or other business decisions.  Develop Tableau dashboards and visualization on customer engagement, revenue and promotions to measure the impacts of various business actions.  Act as the technical SME for groups across the business in regards to sources data, customer process, data manipulation, and analysis techniques(modeling, predictive analytics and data science)  Conduct exploratory analytics to understand data anomalies and elevate meaningful observations for further analysis.  Maintain integrity and quality of data and assure data conformity meets operational requirements and goals.  Assist in planning, establishing and monitoring criteria for data collection.  Ensure report requirements are translated, formatted and integrated into project design and is understood by key stakeholders.  Research Industry data to accurately and granularly classify spend into industry-specific schema.  Build data intelligence around business rules to deliver reportable and actionable information to business leaders.  Create and automate monthly and quarterly sales reports. Qualifications Bachelor degree in business or finance  A minimum of two years’ experience preferably in the healthcare or insurance field.  Must be able to follow instructions and respond to managements’ directions accurately.  Must possess advanced skills in Excel, including Pivot tables, VLOOKUP, INEX/MATCH and data tables.  Must be able to intuitively understand if data looks correct and use a variety of tools and techniques to accomplish data validation and visualization.  Must have advanced skills in SQL, PowerPoint, Tableau, SAS and VBA.  Demonstrate accuracy and thoroughness. Look for ways to improve and promote quality and monitor own work to ensure quality is met.  Must demonstrate effective communication skills by conveying necessary information accurately, listening effectively and asking questions where clarification is needed.  Must be able to work independently, prioritize work activities and use time efficiently.  Must be able to maintain confidentiality.  Must be able to demonstrate team behavior and promote a team-oriented environment.  Must be able to stay focused and concentrate in close quarters under normal or heavy distractions; must be able to work well under pressure and or stressful conditions.  Adapt to change in work environment with the ability to manage change, delays, or unexpected events.  Ability to follow all company policies and procedures in effect at time of hire and as they may change or be added from time to time. Who We AreExamWorks is a leading provider of innovative healthcare services including independent medical examinations, peer reviews, bill reviews, Medicare compliance, case management, record retrieval, document management and related services. Our clients include property and casualty insurance carriers, law firms, third-party claim administrators and government agencies that use independent services to confirm the veracity of claims by sick or injured individuals under automotive, disability, liability and workers' compensation insurance coverages.ExamWorks, LLC is an Equal Opportunity Employer and affords equal opportunity to all qualified applicants for all positions without regard to protected veteran status, qualified individuals with disabilities and all individuals without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age or any other status protected under local, state or federal laws.Equal Opportunity Employer - Minorities/Females/Disabled/VeteransExamWorks offers a fast-paced team atmosphere with competitive benefits (medical, vision, dental), paid time off, and 401k.

title: Epic Analyst - ASAP Team

While candidates need to live or relocate to one of the aforementioned states, working remotely will require reliable broadband internet and personal cell phone service. On-call rotation will begin when the staff member and Team Lead feel the level of skill has been achieved to triage and support end user critical needs.Position SummaryThe Epic Analyst designs, analyzes, develops, tests, implements, and/or provides tier two technical assistance of assigned system applications. and/or information technology within a hospital or clinic, or the equivalent in education and experience, is required.Experience with Microsoft Office programs (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) required for Outreach).Working experience in a healthcare environment such as healthcare operations, clinical areas, or information services.Experience with programming, system analysis, configuration, system implementation, and/or application support.Knowledge of the systems lifecycle, client-server technologies, clinical workflows, and PC application support.Experience with Visio.CertificationsThe Senior levels).Multiple Epic Certifications/accreditations/proficiencies across applications, preferred (both levels).Other Required QualificationsAbility to exercise discretion and independent judgment in a variety of decision-making scenarios.Ability to work independently with little or no day-to-day supervision.Ability to conceptualize the visual effect of the product and how it will be used.Comfortable presenting in front of a group.Good attention to detail and ability to probe for information to fully understand the needs of the customer.Ability to solve problems and troubleshoot and a generous paid time off policy that increases with years of service. For more on our story and award-winning health care, click HERE.More About Asante And Southern OregonAsante is a local, community owned and governed, not-for-profit organization that provides comprehensive health care services to more than 550,000 people in a nine-county area of Southern Oregon and Northern California. At Asante your work positively impacts your family, friends, neighbors and the community. title: Senior Manager Research Analyst - Private Equity
job_description: Company Description RVK is an independently owned, national firm with headquarters in Portland, OR, and regional offices in Boise, ID, Chicago, IL, and New York, NY. We provide unbiased investment consulting services to nearly 200 clients, including corporations, public retirement systems, Taft-Hartley funds, nonprofit organizations, operating reserve funds, high-net-worth individuals and families, and other special purpose funds. The heart of RVK is our team-centered approach to client service, provided by our experienced team of investment consulting professionals. RVK is one of the five largest investment consulting firms in the world, as reported by Pensions & Investments, and is the only firm to be named a Coalition Greenwich Quality Leader among large U.S. investment consultants for a sixth consecutive year. Coalition Greenwich issued the award on April 25, 2023, based on their February through November 2022 study. No direct or indirect compensation has been paid by RVK in connection with obtaining or using this award. To read more about the Greenwich award, please refer to the following URL: https://www.rvkinc.com/about/about.php. Job Summary The Senior Manager Research Analyst - Private Equity (SMRA) focuses on Private Equity markets, with the potential to expand into other private market alternatives more broadly, including private real estate and real assets. The SMRA is responsible for a wide range of investment manager research projects participating in the efforts of the Investment Management Research team. This position supports the Manager Research Consultant that leads due diligence in these asset classes.Duties and Responsibilities Assist Manager Research Consultants in discovery and evaluation of investment managers within Private Equity Assist with alternatives assets class market research and evaluation Maintain alternatives research tools and proprietary databases Communicate continually with investment managers for data collection, product awareness and meeting scheduling Assist with alternatives cash planning projections on behalf of RVK clients Communicate with Manager Research Consultants and members of RVK’s Consulting Teams regarding investment manager searches and research reports Maintain current with industry news and developments Assist with special ad-hoc projects   Minimum QualificationsBachelor’s degree in Finance or Economics Three (3) years of institutional Private Equity industry experience   Preferred Qualifications Chartered Financial Analyst designation and/or Master’s degree preferred Ability to communicate effectively coupled with strong interpersonal skills Strong written and oral communication skills Ability to excel in a deadline-driven environment Ability to travel (averages 2-5 days per month)  Familiarity with research database tools such as Evestment Alliance, Morningstar, Markoff Processes International, Lexis Nexis Additional Information Interested candidates must submit their information through the company website at www.rvkinc.com and select Career Opportunities. No direct solicitations will be accepted. RVK supports workforce diversity and is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) Employer. As an EEO employer, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or national origin. Submit a cover letter detailing how your work and/or academic experience meet the job requirements. Only those candidates whose qualifications meet the job requirements will be contacted. No phone calls or faxes. No staffing agencies please.

title: Payroll HRIS Analyst
job_description: 1At Precision Castparts (PCC), we make extraordinary products for aerospace and other industries. This is made possible by the hard work and creativity of a diverse and global workforce. We are committed to fostering a culture of inclusiveness, empowerment and respect that embraces the differences in who we are. Working together, we will continue to solve complex problems every day.We are relentless in our dedication to being a high-quality and on-time producer, delivering the highest value to our customers while continually pursuing strategic, profitable growth. PCC employs more than 20,000 people worldwide in over 120 plants spread across twenty-six states in the US and over a dozen countries.Job Description 1The Payroll HRIS Analyst will serve as the system administrator for our payroll platform (ADP Vantage), ensuring data integrity, user access, and security. This role will be instrumental in troubleshooting system issues, developing reports, and participating in system enhancements and upgrades. The ideal candidate will possess strong analytical skills, technical proficiency with ADP Vantage, and a solid understanding of payroll processes and regulations. Additionally, the Payroll HRIS Analyst will collaborate with stakeholders, provide training and support to system users, and contribute to company-wide projects.Primary Duties and Responsibilities:Serve as a system administrator, responsible for role-based user security and ensuring appropriate user access and data integrity.Act as business technical analyst to identify, troubleshoot, and resolve ADP Vantage system issues.Develop and maintain queries and reports to support payroll processes, requests from users and management, and regulatory requirements in a timely manner while driving standardization across the organization where possible.Participates in the implementation of system enhancements, upgrades and integrations including testing new ADP Vantage features and functionalities.Setup and maintain Standard Operation Procedures (SOPs), including working with internal and external auditors on process workflows and key audit controls.Provides training and support to system users, ensuring they can effectively use ADP Vantage. This includes creating user procedure guidelines and documentation, training sessions, and offering support for any user queries or difficulties.Analyze payroll data and business processes to identify trends, discrepancies, and areas for improvement.Gather detailed requirements for identified changes or enhancements.Collaborate on payroll initiatives and other company-wide projects.Ensure compliance with company policy, local, state, and federal laws related to assigned projects.Assist with audits and reporting.Conduct or support year end payroll tasks.Backup to Corporate Payroll processing and reporting.Other duties as assigned.Required Experience/Skills:Bachelor’s Degree information systems or related field.At least 2 to 4 years in a role with payroll or accounting systems administration responsibility, exhibiting knowledge, application, and systems configuration testing. Experience with ADP Vantage required.Required Excel high proficiency.Researching and understanding employment, payroll, timekeeping, and wage & hour concepts and regulations.Using strong analytical, time management, and organizational skills.Demonstrating excellent written, verbal, and presentation skills.Must be highly self-motivated and able to handle multiple priorities.Able to work in an environment with frequent interruptions and changing tasks and priorities.Continuous learner interested in both tinkering with software and navigating the complexities of Payroll.Capacity to understand business needs and design workflows and processes in accordance.1All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.This position requires use of information or access to production processes subject to national security controls under U.S. export control laws and regulations (including, but not limited to the International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR) and the Export Administration Regulations (EAR)). To be qualified to work in this facility, a successful applicant must be a U.S. Person, as defined in those regulations, and able to supply evidence of that qualification prior to starting work or be authorized to receive controlled information under a specific license or permission from the relevant government agency. The U.S. export control regulations define a U.S. person as a U.S. Citizen, U.S. National, U.S. Permanent Resident (i.e. 'Green Card Holder'), and certain categories of Asylees and Refugees.

title: Product Data Analyst
job_description: This inclusive employer is a member of myGwork – the largest global platform for the LGBTQ+ business community.  Product Data AnalystDo you enjoy being part of a team that works with a diverse range of products /technology?Are you looking for an innovative role?About The BusinessLexisNexis Risk Solutions is the essential partner in the assessment of risk. Within our Business Services vertical, we offer a multitude of solutions focused on helping businesses of all sizes drive higher revenue growth, maximize operational efficiencies, and improve customer experience. Our solutions help our customers solve difficult problems in the areas of Anti-Money Laundering/Counter Terrorist Financing, Identity Authentication & Verification, Fraud and Credit Risk mitigation and Customer Data Management. You can learn more about LexisNexis Risk at the link below, risk.lexisnexis.comAbout The TeamProduct Operations at LexisNexis Risk aims to "Unlock product growth by reimagining How". This team works to promote excellence, remove barriers, and align the business around a future oriented around product growth. This team promotes cross-functional connections, business insight, and operational efficiency between the global Product team members and their cross-functional peers, increasing leverage so that LexisNexis product teams can ultimately deliver more value to customers, faster.About The RoleWe are seeking a Product Data Analyst that will utilize product performance data to communicate customer problems and opportunities ultimately to help inform product strategy. This individual will conduct discovery with a variety of product stakeholders to understand the desired outcomes that help promote faster and smarter business decisions. This individual will own the collection, analysis of the organization's data inputs, and problem solving to propose data-driven insights for the business. These data-driven insights will be provided to product members across all areas with a focus on storytelling and tool automation when possible. Candidates must be highly capable in each of the following dimensions (among others): attention to detail, results oriented, adaptable, resourceful, analytical thinking/problem solving, proactive thinking, collaborative, contain a level of business acumen and technological savvy, and comfortable operating with/through a lean team.You Will Be Responsible ForUtilizing cross-functional data to correlate trends and identify strategic actions.Transforming data into actionable insights by designing information to be presented in the most impactful way to the viewer.Advocating for best practices in data insight tools and instrumentation.Automating data correlation, analysis, and reporting at every opportunity.Working with stakeholders to establish key performance indicators and monitoring implemented programs to measure ongoing success.Working to develop a wide network of strategic and trusted cross-functional relationships in order to stay informed on operational frustration and effectiveness.Performing all other duties as assigned.QualificationsHave experience answering specific quantitative questions and identifying trends and patterns in large data sets.Have experience using data visualization tools and building custom visualizations and reports, including Microsoft PowerBI.Have demonstratable time management and prioritization skills.Have knowledge of project management tools and practices.Have bachelor's or equivalent experience.Have experience with data and analytics technology.Learn more about the LexisNexis Risk team and how we work here

Every day, we deliver legendary customer experiences to over 27 million households and businesses in Canada, the United States and around the world. More than 95,000 TD colleagues bring their skills, talent, and creativity to the Bank, those we serve, and the economies we support. Total Rewards at TD includes base salary and variable compensation/incentive awards (e.g., eligibility for cash and/or equity incentive awards, generally through participation in an incentive plan) and several other key plans such as health and well-being benefits, savings and retirement programs, paid time off (including Vacation PTO, Flex PTO, and Holiday PTO), banking benefits and discounts, career development, and reward and recognition. title: Sr. Financial Analyst, SEC Financial Reporting
job_description: Join our Corporate Finance Team at Helen of Troy as a Sr. Financial Analyst, SEC Financial Reporting (hybrid and onsite), and make an immediate impact on our trusted brands: OXO, Hydro Flask, Osprey, Honeywell, PUR, Braun, Vicks, Hot Tools, Drybar, Curlsmith, and Revlon. Together, we build innovative and useful products that elevate people's lives everywhere every day!Look around you at home, and you'll find us everywhere:In your kitchen, living room, bedroom, and bathroom. We are already making your everyday lives better. We are powered by knowledgeable, enthusiastic, and forward-thinking people committed to developing a culture of inclusion. Whether you are just starting your career or in need of a challenge, we recognize, develop, and empower talent!Work Location: This position is open to candidates based near our office locations in the following cities/states -Bend, OREl Paso, TXDallas, TXCortez, COMarlborough, MABoston, MAArlington, TNEdgewater, NJNew York, NYCandidate must be willing to work Eastern or Central time zone business hours.What you will be doing:The Senior Financial Analyst, SEC Financial Reporting is a crucial member of our Corporate Finance and Accounting team. They will report directly to the Director of External Reporting. They will assist in preparing all SEC filings and in supporting the Corporate Finance team on technical accounting matters and transactions. They will prepare, compile, and review various financial analyses and information prepared by other accounting and operating functions. Ideally, they are a proactive and team-oriented individual with a strong work ethic and excitement to take on new challenges.Support all external financial reporting including SEC filings (10-Ks, 10-Qs, Proxy Statements, 8-Ks, Form 3s, Form 4s, earnings releases, investor presentations, etc.) and press releases, etc.Assist in the electronic filing of such documents through the Workiva filing platform.Assist with preparing footnote disclosures and earnings release financial tables, including non-GAAP reconciliations, investor presentations, etc.Prepare initial drafts of ad hoc SEC filings, such as 8-Ks.Prepare diluted earnings per share and weighted average shares outstanding calculations.Assist in the preparation of beneficial ownership Form 3s and Form 4s to be filed with the SEC regularly.Assist with the coordination and updating of SEC filing drafts throughout the various stages of the preparation and review process based upon input, review, and commentary provided by other members of the external disclosure team.Support the Corporate Accounting department in maintaining the company’s lease portfolio, related amortization schedules, monthly journal entries, and general ledger reconciliations.Automate processes and internal procedures to compile and analyze data for SEC reporting purposes utilizing Hyperion reporting functionalities.Assist with quarterly and year-end audits with external auditors to ensure compliance and timely reporting.Support the department by acting as a Workiva Financial Reporting System specialist.Participate in special and recurring technical accounting projects, as needed.Research accounting and disclosure topics using the various research tools available to us (EY Atlas, etc.) and assist in the preparation of internal memorandums to detail the company’s approach to evolving financial reporting issues, as needed.Assist in maintaining and continuously improving financial reporting policies, processes, and controls.Skills needed to be successful in this role:Strong attention to detail with the ability to prepare high-quality work products in a deadline-driven environment.Outstanding work ethic and the ability to build cross-functional partnerships.Ability to work with minimal up-front guidance and take ownership of work project(s).Execute procedures to create efficiencies and seek out opportunities for process improvement.Able to work independently and as part of a team as well as balance multiple projects in a fast-paced work environment.Excellent communication, presentation, and social skills, including verbal and written with an executive presence.Minimum QualificationsBachelor's degree from an accredited four-year college or university in accounting or finance.3+ years’ experience in accounting or finance.Public accounting experience or experience within a publicly traded company.Must have a CPA or commit to a definite plan to become one over a three to five-year horizon.Technical Competence – Strong knowledge and understanding of US GAAP and ability to research and analyze accounting issues and impacts under applicable accounting guidance.Intermediate experience with Microsoft applications, including Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook.Applicants must be authorized to work in the United States on a full-time basis.Preferred Qualifications:Consumer product/retail sector experience.Experience or exposure to Workiva.In California, Colorado, and New York City, the standard base pay range for this role is $70,287- $136,796 annually. This base pay range is specific to California, Colorado, and New York City and may not apply to other locations. Actual salaries will vary based on several factors, including but not limited to location, experience, skill level, and performance. The range listed is just one component of the total compensation package for employees.Benefits: Salary + Bonus, Healthcare, Dental, Vision, Paid Holidays, Paid Parental Leave, 401(k) with company match, Basic Life Insurance, Short Term Disability (STD), Long Term Disability (LTD), Paid Time Off (PTO), Paid Charitable (volunteer) Leave, and Educational Assistance.Wondering if you should apply? Helen of Troy welcomes people as diverse as our brands. Have the confidence to come as who you are because your point of view, skills, and experience will make us stronger. If you're eager to share new ideas and try new things, we want to hear from you.For more information about Helen of Troy, visit www.helenoftroy.com. You can also find us on LinkedIn, Glassdoor, Facebook, Instagram and Twitter.Helen of Troy is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. We are committed to developing a diverse workforce and cultivating an inclusive environment. We value diversity and believe that we are strengthened by the differences in our experiences, thinking, culture and background. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, marital status, disability, protected veteran status or any protected basis.We will provide individuals with disabilities reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application process. If you would like to request an accommodation, please contact Human Resources at (915) 225-8000.Founded in 1968, Helen of Troy is a prominent player in the global consumer products industry, offering diverse career opportunities across North America, South America, Europe, and Asia. We boast a collection of renowned brands such as OXO®, Hydro Flask®, Osprey®, Honeywell®, PUR®, Braun®, Vicks®, Hot Tools®, and Drybar® – many of which rank #1, #2, or #3 in their respective categories, making the Helen of Troy name synonymous with excellence and ingenuity.At Helen of Troy, our strategy involves acquiring brands that we can integrate and enhance, amplifying their unique attributes to drive growth and profitability. Embracing a culture of collaboration internally and externally, we are committed to providing innovative solutions tailored to consumers, operational excellence, global scalability, and exceptional shared services to support our brand portfolio. This dedication to fostering development and success sets Helen of Troy apart as a pioneer in the industry, propelling our brands to unparalleled heights of success and recognition worldwide.The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work performed by people assigned to this classification. They are not intended to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities and duties required of personnel so classified. Management retains the right to add or to change duties of the position at any time.

title: Senior Financial Analyst
job_description: Job Title Senior Financial AnalystDepartment FinanceLocation Hybrid - Milwaukie, ORShift Monday - Friday, 8-hour Day ShiftWage $48.81 - $64.31 per hour, depending on years of experienceOur success begins and ends with our people. We embrace diverse perspectives and value unique human experiences. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer that celebrates the diversity of the communities where we live and do business. Applicants for our positions are considered without regard to race, ethnicity, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, religion, military or veteran status, or any other characteristics protected by law.Company Overview At Bob’s Red Mill, we inspire joy with wholesome foods. Since 1978, we have been leading the natural foods industry by providing our customers with good food that makes them feel great. Wholesome means ensuring our food is of the highest quality, empowering and supporting our diverse group of employee owners, respecting our planet, and bettering our communities. We believe that joy is for everyone.We believe taking care of our community starts with giving our employee owners the resources to take care of their physical, mental, financial, and future well-being by offering a leading benefits package.Medical, Dental, and Vision Insurance 401k, Profit Sharing Program, and Employee Stock Ownership Program (ESOP) Paid Holidays & Vacation 25% Retail Store Discount Employee Assistance Program – counseling, legal issue support, financial guidance, and more. Tuition Reimbursement Childcare Discounts And MORE! Purpose To inspire joy with wholesome foods.Values Respect, Teamwork, Accountability, DeterminationPosition Overview The Senior Financial Analyst assists the Finance Manager and Director of Finance with projects related to company profitability and reporting, including, but not limited to, monthly reporting, variance analysis, budgeting and forecasting, review of product margins, and overall profitability.Essential Job FunctionsAnalyzes complex financial information to provide accurate and timely results and recommendations to management for decision making purposes. Performs margin review on customers and products; produces and monitors various sales KPIs. Assists Finance Manager with annual budget and quarterly forecast estimates, as well as departmental budget-to-actual and forecast-to-actual variance analysis. Helps develop new reports with large datasets to translate results into meaningful metrics and insights. Monitors data to identify changes in financial and business trends. Provides insight into current reporting capabilities and identifies opportunities for improvement. Reviews reports and data for completeness, accuracy, and reasonableness and brings attention to issues. Works as a part of a team to help meet monthly goals. Complies with all company policies and procedures and operates all equipment in a safe and food-safe manner. Complies with Bob’s Red Mill food safety policies and procedures including adherence to FDA regulations, Safe Quality Food (SQF) Standards, and Good Manufacturing Practices (GMPs).  Responsible for reporting food safety and quality concerns to Supervisors and/or Department Manager.  Performs other duties and tasks as assigned.  Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities Possesses effective communication skills, both verbal and written. Effective problem-solving skills. Ability to work effectively with a team using direct communication, respect, creativity, and emotional intelligence. Ability to stay organized and meet deadlines. Skilled in paying close attention to detail. Ability to balance multiple needs and priorities. Ability to collaborate with all departments and staff within the company. Ability to self-motivate and proactively make decisions. Ability to adapt to changes, problems, and shifting priorities. Skilled in analyzing and interpreting data to provide actionable insights. Skilled in using Microsoft 365, including Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook. Ability to use advanced Excel functions, including but not limited to formulas, pivot tables, and graphs. Ability to work independently and in collaboration with others. In-depth understanding of GAAP and best practices. Ability to read, understand, and communicate information effectively in English with professional proficiency. Demonstrates Respect, Teamwork, Accountability, and Determination. Ability to work in an environment where exposure to potential food allergens is or may be present. Supervisory ResponsibilitiesNone. This position reports to the Finance Manager. Education and Experience8 or more years of finance or accounting experience, AND Bachelor’s Degree in finance or accounting; OR Any combination of education and additional years of experience that provides the necessary skills, knowledge, and ability to perform assigned tasks. Preferred SkillsProficient in using ERP and supporting software. Skilled in using business intelligence tools, including data warehouses, visualization tools, and relational database systems. Knowledge of consumer packaged goods accounting needs. Willing to TrainInternal processes, systems, and procedures. Physical Demands Position requires the ability to sit for up to approximately 2 hours at a time. Work Environment The primary environment for this position is in an office setting or remote. There are no adverse conditions associated with this environment. This position may occasionally spend a small amount of time within the production and warehouse areas of the facility. Remote work may be available as an option. Employees will be exposed to common food allergens.

title: Senior Treasury Analyst Financial Markets
job_description: 1At Precision Castparts (PCC), we make extraordinary products for aerospace and other industries. This is made possible by the hard work and creativity of a diverse and global workforce. We are committed to fostering a culture of inclusiveness, empowerment and respect that embraces the differences in who we are. Working together, we will continue to solve complex problems every day.We are relentless in our dedication to being a high-quality and on-time producer, delivering the highest value to our customers while continually pursuing strategic, profitable growth. PCC employs more than 24,000 people worldwide in over 120 plants spread across twenty-six states in the US and over a dozen countries.Job Description 1The Senior Treasury Analyst will be responsible for supporting PCC’s global treasury functions in a dynamic, fast-paced environment.Primary Duties and Responsibilities:Facilitates Treasury functions to provide advanced support to senior team members, including:Assist in managing PCC’s foreign exchange (FX) & natural gas hedging programs, including exposure analysis, identifying hedge requirements in accordance with Policy and coordinating hedge settlementsBecome proficient with PCC’s derivative accounting software, online currency trading platform, and trade confirmation and settlement systemDevelop a thorough understanding of ASC 815, the US GAAP hedge accounting standard; assist in compliance with derivative/banking regulations, including LEI maintenance, KYC and regulatory reportingPerform monthly/quarterly/annual tasks such as reconciliation of GL accounts, journal entry preparation, and cash/debt/derivative analysis & reportingMaintain Treasury department SOX documentation and coordinate updates when necessarySupport Treasury Operations with daily cash positioning, investment of excess cash, cash forecasting, interest accrual preparation, bank system administration, fee analysis/monitoring, letters of credit, and initiation of funds transfersSupport company-wide leasing activitiesPerform ad hoc analysis of corporate finance and treasury issues, including bank fees & services, NPV/IRR, cost-benefit and lease vs buy analysisIdentify process improvement opportunities and assist integration of recently acquired entitiesRequired Experience/Skills:Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, Economics or similar technical field of study5-7 years’ combined experience in treasury, accounting, or other finance-related field; experience with FX hedging/derivatives and/or public accounting a strong plusCTP, CFA or CPA preferredA high level of motivation and initiative; a team player with a service-oriented approachAbility to prioritize and work effectively and accurately in a fast-paced environmentExtremely organized with demonstrated attention to detail and accuracyProblem solving abilities, along with excellent interpersonal and communication skillsProficient in Microsoft Office Suite, including advanced knowledge of Excel; data management skills such as pivot tables, V/Hlookups, and macros preferredPossess a “can do” attitude with a willingness to grow and learn1All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.

title: Senior Salesforce Developer
job_description: Every day, we work together for what matters – bold, swift, and equitable climate action.About The Role3Degrees is a certified B Corp committed to leading transformational change in how companies engage with climate issues. Technology is fundamental to achieving our mission, and that's where you come in. As the Senior Salesforce Developer at 3Degrees, you'll be more than just an IT leader, you'll be a digital visionary. Your expertise will support our teams to empower companies around the world to reduce their carbon footprint, aiding the quest for a sustainable future. You will help integrate our technology infrastructure, pioneering solutions that improve efficiency and drive innovation.This is a full-time exempt position and will report to the Systems Architect. This position is open to candidates ideally based within a commutable distance of our offices including Portland, ME, New York, NY , San Francisco, California or Portland, OR; where you'll enjoy a flexible hybrid working environment. Exceptional candidates based outside of the listed locations may also be considered. In addition, you agree to travel, periodically to 3Degree's offices for training or team collaboration and to conferences and customers as required. Frequency and cadence is team dependent, but on average is 1-6 times annually.What You’ll DoYour responsibilities include developing and maintaining Salesforce customizations, configurations, and integrations to support several business processes and objectives. Collaborating closely with the sales, marketing, and operations teams, you'll identify opportunities for process improvements and implement solutions to optimize business performance. Additionally, you will work with IT teams to ensure smooth integration between Salesforce and other business systems.Lead Salesforce development projects, ensuring alignment with business objectives Create and maintain custom Salesforce solutions to boost business teams’ performance Integrate Salesforce with various business systems, enhancing data flow Manage Salesforce security settings, workflows, and user access controls Develop automation in Salesforce for process efficiency Liaise with business teams to translate needs into Salesforce functionalities Build custom reports and dashboards for sales insights Conduct Salesforce end-user training and develop educational resources Keep abreast of Salesforce updates and emerging technologies Troubleshoot Salesforce integration issues in collaboration with integration teams Perform regular system audits for data accuracy and efficiency Collaborate with other IT resources to align Salesforce with business technology strategies Identify and implement process improvements in Salesforce Work with IT architects, integration developers, and other platform developers to design and implement complex cross-platform solutions About YouAs a Senior Salesforce Developer, you will be critical in enhancing our business teams’ effectiveness through the Salesforce platform. Your expertise in Salesforce development, combined with a strong understanding of business operations and platform integrations, will be pivotal in driving our strategy and supporting our broader organizational goals. We believe an individual with the following skills, experience, and subject matter expertise would be well-suited to be successful in this role:5+ years of experience in Salesforce development, with a focus on both admin and developer roles Strong expertise in Salesforce, including various Salesforce clouds (Sales, Service, Marketing, etc.) and Salesforce development environments Proficiency in Apex, Visualforce, and Salesforce Lightning Must have extensive experience with Salesforce Flow, triggers, validation rules, In-depth knowledge of and experience with RESTful and SOAP API protocols Understanding of API security standards and protocols (OAuth, JWT, etc.) Skilled in multiple programming languages relevant to Salesforce (e.g., Java, JavaScript) Familiarity with both SQL/SOQL and NoSQL databases as well as JSON format Expertise in data mapping and transformation techniques Proficiency in process mapping and documentation tools like Lucid Chart Experience with CI/CD practices in Salesforce, including the use of development orgs Proficiency in version control systems like Git/GitHub Understanding of event-driven and message-driven architectures in Salesforce Knowledge of data privacy standards and regulations applicable to Salesforce Excellent communication skills for effective collaboration with technical and non-technical stakeholders Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to work under pressure Good documentation practices within Salesforce Experience with Agile development frameworks and methodologies Previous experience as a business analyst preferred Combination of at least one Salesforce developer and one other advanced certification (e.g., Salesforce Certified Platform Developer I/II, Salesforce Certified App Builder, Advanced Salesforce Administrator, Application/System Architect, etc.)B.S. degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or equivalent professional experience How We Define SuccessWithin 30 days,Gain an understanding of 3Degrees IT infrastructure, Salesforce integration needs, current implementations, and the portfolio of ongoing Salesforce development projects Begin contributing to ongoing Salesforce projects, suggesting improvements, and grasping business requirements Within 90 days,Assume responsibility for managing and administering our Salesforce platform Lead new Salesforce projects, initiating the delivery of solutions Within 6 months,Establish yourself internally as the key resource for Salesforce implementations, significantly enhancing our Salesforce capabilities Successfully lead and complete a Salesforce project, demonstrating enhanced business processes/operations and process efficiency Compensation & BenefitsCompensation: The minimum and maximum salary for this position is $105,000 to $151,000 in the US. The level of pay within the range will depend on a variety of job-related factors that may include location, role requirements, relevant prior experience and/or education, or particular skills and expertise Benefits: This position is eligible for a benefits package that includes medical, dental, vision, 401k, flexible paid time off, and more. Additional information regarding the benefits available for this position can be found by clicking here Supplemental Pay: This position may be eligible to participate in discretionary bonus programs based on personal, department and company goals(This compensation and benefits information is based on 3Degrees' good faith estimate as of the date of publication and may be modified in the future)OUR COMMITMENT TO DIVERSITY, INCLUSION, AND EQUITY3Degrees is an equal-opportunity employer. title: Sr. Salesforce Developer
job_description: We are a leading global software company dedicated to the world of computer aided design, 3D modeling and simulation— helping innovative global manufacturers design better products, faster! With the resources of a large company, and the energy of a software start-up, we have fun together while creating a world class software portfolio. Our culture encourages creativity, welcomes fresh thinking, and focuses on growth, so our people, our business, and our customers can achieve their full potential.Key Responsibilities: Designs, Develops, and implements software automation of complex business processes for internal customers and external interfaces using Salesforce.com technology such as advance Apex Advance development, Lightning web components, Trigger, Aura, Rest API. Performs a key role in application design, custom development, technical documentation, testing, and tier-2 maintenance. Interacts with internal customer and analyst leads. Conducts general user support, corrections, reporting and enhancements, while also playing a key role on larger projects. Demonstrates advanced proficiency within an applied technical area, such as SFDC Sales Cloud, Service Cloud, Communities, Informatica and Lightning framework to name a few. Operates under minimal supervision, with latitude for decision making and cross-team communication. Acts as intermediate advisor.Qualifications: Bachler in engineering, B-TECH or equivalent degree. Minimum 6+ Years of experience in salesforce development. 2+ years of experience in CPQ implementation in Salesforce. Experience in CPQ, Product & Pricing configuration, configuring bundle and quote process, Customizing CPQ application, Integration with different system such as ERP, Invoicing (Steel Brick CPQ experience recommended). Salesforce CPQ and Billing development Configuration experience. Deployment with multi-level sandbox experience in Copado is preferable.We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. Qualified Applicants will not require employer sponsored work authorization now or in the future for employment in the United States.Why us? Working at Siemens Software means flexibility - Choosing between working at home and the office at other times is the norm here. We offer great benefits and rewards, as you'd expect from a world leader in industrial software.A collection of over 377,000 minds building the future, one day at a time in over 200 countries. We're dedicated to equality, and we welcome applications that reflect the diversity of the communities we work in. All employment decisions at Siemens are based on qualifications, merit, and business need. Bring your curiosity and creativity and help us shape tomorrow!Siemens Software.
